segment.source: Read about solutions to common development issues with the Microsoft advertising libraries in JavaScript/HTML apps.
segment.target: Read about solutions to common development issues with the Microsoft advertising libraries in JavaScript/HTML apps.

segment.source: HTML and JavaScript troubleshooting guide
segment.target: HTML and JavaScript troubleshooting guide

segment.source: HTML and JavaScript troubleshooting guide
segment.target: HTML and JavaScript troubleshooting guide

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: This topic contains solutions to common development issues with the Microsoft advertising libraries in JavaScript/HTML apps.
segment.target: This topic contains solutions to common development issues with the Microsoft advertising libraries in JavaScript/HTML apps.

segment.source: HTML
segment.target: HTML

segment.source: AdControl not appearing
segment.target: AdControl not appearing

segment.target: Black box blinks and disappears

segment.source: HTML
segment.target: HTML

segment.source: AdControl not appearing
segment.target: AdControl not appearing

segment.source: Ensure that the Internet (Client) capability is selected in Package.appxmanifest.
segment.target: Ensure that the Internet (Client) capability is selected in Package.appxmanifest.

segment.source: Ensure the JavaScript reference is present.
segment.target: Ensure the JavaScript reference is present.

segment.source: Without the ad.js reference in the head section (after the default.js reference) the AdControl will be unable to display and an error will occur during build.
segment.target: Without the ad.js reference in the head section (after the default.js reference) the AdControl will be unable to display and an error will occur during build.

segment.source: Windows 10:
segment.target: Windows 10:

segment.source: Windows 8.x:
segment.target: Windows 8.x:

segment.source: Check the application ID and ad unit ID.
segment.target: Check the application ID and ad unit ID.

segment.source: These IDs must match the application ID and ad unit ID that you obtained in Windows Dev Center.
segment.target: These IDs must match the application ID and ad unit ID that you obtained in Windows Dev Center.

segment.source: For more information, see Set up ad units in your app.
segment.target: For more information, see Set up ad units in your app.

segment.source: Check the height and width properties.
segment.target: Check the height and width properties.

segment.source: These must be set to one of the supported ad sizes for banner ads.
segment.target: These must be set to one of the supported ad sizes for banner ads.

segment.source: Check the element positioning.
segment.target: Check the element positioning.

segment.source: The AdControl must be inside the viewable area.
segment.target: The AdControl must be inside the viewable area.

segment.source: Check the visibility property.
segment.target: Check the visibility property.

segment.source: This property must not be set to collapsed or hidden.
segment.target: This property must not be set to collapsed or hidden.

segment.source: This property can be set inline (as shown below) or in an external style sheet.
segment.target: This property can be set inline (as shown below) or in an external style sheet.

segment.source: Check the position property.
segment.target: Check the position property.

segment.source: The position property must be set to an appropriate value depending on the element’s other properties (for example, margins in parent element and z-index).
segment.target: The position property must be set to an appropriate value depending on the element’s other properties (for example, margins in parent element and z-index).

segment.source: This property can be set inline (as shown below) or in an external style sheet.
segment.target: This property can be set inline (as shown below) or in an external style sheet.

segment.source: Check the z-index property.
segment.target: Check the z-index property.

segment.source: The z-index property must be set high enough so the AdControl always appears on top of other elements.
segment.target: The z-index property must be set high enough so the AdControl always appears on top of other elements.

segment.source: This property can be set inline (as shown below) or in an external style sheet.
segment.target: This property can be set inline (as shown below) or in an external style sheet.

segment.source: Check external style sheets.
segment.target: Check external style sheets.

segment.source: If properties are set on the AdControl element through an external style sheet, ensure all of the above properties are correctly set.
segment.target: If properties are set on the AdControl element through an external style sheet, ensure all of the above properties are correctly set.

segment.source: Check the parent of the AdControl.
segment.target: Check the parent of the AdControl.

segment.source: If the AdControl resides in a parent element, the parent must be active and visible.
segment.target: If the AdControl resides in a parent element, the parent must be active and visible.

segment.source: Ensure the AdControl is not hidden from the viewport.
segment.target: Ensure the AdControl is not hidden from the viewport.

segment.source: The AdControl must be visible for ads to display properly.
segment.target: The AdControl must be visible for ads to display properly.

segment.source: Live values for ApplicationId and AdUnitId should not be tested in the emulator.
segment.target: Live values for ApplicationId and AdUnitId should not be tested in the emulator.

segment.source: To ensure the AdControl is functioning as expected, use the test IDs for both ApplicationId and AdUnitId found in Test mode values.
segment.target: To ensure the AdControl is functioning as expected, use the test IDs for both ApplicationId and AdUnitId found in Test mode values.

segment.source: Black box blinks and disappears
segment.target: Black box blinks and disappears

segment.source: Double-check all steps in the previous AdControl not appearing section.
segment.target: Double-check all steps in the previous AdControl not appearing section.

segment.source: Handle the onErrorOccurred event, and use the message that is passed to the event handler to determine whether an error occurred and what type of error was thrown.
segment.target: Handle the onErrorOccurred event, and use the message that is passed to the event handler to determine whether an error occurred and what type of error was thrown.

segment.source: More details can be found in Error handling in JavaScript walkthrough.
segment.target: More details can be found in Error handling in JavaScript walkthrough.

segment.source: The most common error that causes a black box is “No ad available.”
segment.target: The most common error that causes a black box is “No ad available.”

segment.source: This error means there is no ad available to return from the request.
segment.target: This error means there is no ad available to return from the request.

segment.source: The AdControl is behaving normally.
segment.target: The AdControl is behaving normally.

segment.source: By default, the AdControl will collapse when it cannot display an ad.
segment.target: By default, the AdControl will collapse when it cannot display an ad.

segment.source: If other elements are children of the same parent they may move to fill the gap of the collapsed AdControl and expand when the next request is made.
segment.target: If other elements are children of the same parent they may move to fill the gap of the collapsed AdControl and expand when the next request is made.

segment.source: Ads not refreshing
segment.target: Ads not refreshing

segment.source: Check the isAutoRefreshEnabled property.
segment.target: Check the isAutoRefreshEnabled property.

segment.source: By default, this optional property is set to true.
segment.target: By default, this optional property is set to true.

segment.source: When set to false, the refresh method must be used to retrieve another ad.
segment.target: When set to false, the refresh method must be used to retrieve another ad.

segment.source: Check calls to the refresh method.
segment.target: Check calls to the refresh method.

segment.source: When using automatic refresh, refresh cannot be used to retrieve another ad.
segment.target: When using automatic refresh, refresh cannot be used to retrieve another ad.

segment.source: When using manual refresh, refresh should be called only after a minimum of 30 to 60 seconds depending on the device’s current data connection.
segment.target: When using manual refresh, refresh should be called only after a minimum of 30 to 60 seconds depending on the device’s current data connection.

segment.source: This example demonstrates how to use the refresh method.
segment.target: This example demonstrates how to use the refresh method.

segment.source: The following HTML code shows an example of how to instantiate the AdControl with isAutoRefreshEnabled set to false.
segment.target: The following HTML code shows an example of how to instantiate the AdControl with isAutoRefreshEnabled set to false.

segment.source: Theis example demonstrates how to use the refresh function.
segment.target: Theis example demonstrates how to use the refresh function.

segment.source: The AdControl is behaving normally.
segment.target: The AdControl is behaving normally.

segment.source: Sometimes the same ad will appear more than once in a row giving the appearance that ads are not refreshing.
segment.target: Sometimes the same ad will appear more than once in a row giving the appearance that ads are not refreshing.

segment.source: Ensure the AdControl is instantiated.
segment.target: Ensure the AdControl is instantiated.

segment.source: If the AdControl is not instantiated.
segment.target: If the AdControl is not instantiated.

segment.source: it will not be available.
segment.target: it will not be available.

segment.source: Check the parent element.
segment.target: Check the parent element.

segment.source: The parent div must be correctly assigned, active, and visible.
segment.target: The parent div must be correctly assigned, active, and visible.

segment.source: Check the application ID and ad unit ID.
segment.target: Check the application ID and ad unit ID.

segment.source: These IDs must match the application ID and ad unit ID that you obtained in Windows Dev Center.
segment.target: These IDs must match the application ID and ad unit ID that you obtained in Windows Dev Center.

segment.source: For more information, see Set up ad units in your app.
segment.target: For more information, see Set up ad units in your app.

segment.source: Check the parent element of the AdControl.
segment.target: Check the parent element of the AdControl.

segment.source: The parent must be active and visible.
segment.target: The parent must be active and visible.

segment.source: Live values for ApplicationId and AdUnitId should not be tested in the emulator.
segment.target: Live values for ApplicationId and AdUnitId should not be tested in the emulator.

segment.source: To ensure the AdControl is functioning as expected, use the test IDs for both ApplicationId and AdUnitId found in Test mode values.
